alert.note: Alert for Butler; Carter; Ripley (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 06 at 11:46PM CST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Carter, Ripley and northwestern Butler Counties through 1230 AM CST... At 1145 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Hunter to 6 miles northwest of Gatewood to 6 miles northeast of Hardy. Movement was northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Hunter around 1150 PM CST. Ellsinore around 1155 PM CST. Brush Arbor around 1200 AM CST. Other locations in the path of these storms include Budapest, Milltown, Doniphan, Hendrickson, Oxly and Fairdealing. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CST for southeastern Missouri.
